cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 105 miles ESE of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across Hispaniola today, then turning north-northwest and riding up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches in effect for the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for Puerto Rico, U.S./British Virgin Islands, Dominican Republic, Haiti north coast, Turks & Caicos, and the central-southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Caribbean islands today, Bahamas Friday-Saturday, Florida peninsula this weekend, then entire U.S. Atlantic coastline from Georgia to New England Monday-Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 kt) possible late Monday night into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay and tidal Potomac if the storm tracks inland of the bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 3–6 inches with localized totals over 4 inches, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High waves and dangerous rip currents along Chesapeake approaches; brief tornadic squalls cannot be ruled out
